description: Heuristics for systems that must survive deep uncertainty and disorder.

core_concepts.definition: A property of systems that improve under stress, volatility, and error.
The requirement that agents bear significant downside from their own decisions.
In complex domains, subtraction outperforms addition.

principles: Forecasts in fat-tailed domains carry negative expected information.
Complexity without proven survival value is fragility.
Time is the only reliable judge of truth.
Symmetry of risk is the foundation of justice.
